articles.description: While our phones could help halt the spread of coronavirus through the new tracing app, research shows they could also be spreading it.
articles.content:
"All of the literature shows there are hundreds of [strains of] bacteria on our phones."
Professor Tajouri said the studies examined in this research did not concentrate on viruses, however other research being conducted at Bond University was, and in additi… [+1907 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus Australia: ACT COVID-19 free - Herald Sun
articles.description: There have been no new cases of COVID-19 recorded in the ACT in the past 24 hours. The ACT’s total stands at 106.
articles.content:
There have been no new cases of COVID-19 recorded in the ACT in the past 24 hours. The ACTs total stands at 106.
A total of 103 cases have recovered from COVID-19 and have been released from self-isolation.
There are no active cases in the ACT.
